bill_title: Proposing and submitting to the electors at the next general election an amendment to Article XI of the Constitution of the State of South Dakota, relating to the limitation of expenditures for the State of South Dakota.

bill_versions.bill_text: A JOINT RESOLUTION, Proposing and submitting to the electors at the next general election an amendment to Article XI of the Constitution of the State of South Dakota, relating to the limitation of expenditures for the State of South Dakota. BE IT RESOLVED BY THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA, THE SENATE CONCURRING THEREIN: Section 1. That at the next general election held in the state, the following amendment to Article XI of the Constitution of the State of South Dakota, as set forth in section 2 of this Joint Resolution, which is hereby agreed to, shall be submitted to the electors of the state for approval. Section 2. That Article XI of the Constitution of the State of South Dakota, be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read as follows: § 16. A limit is hereby established on the estimated ordinary general fund expenses of the state for each year. Effective with the first fiscal year beginning after the ratification of this section and in each fiscal year thereafter, the Legislature may not appropriate for the estimated ordinary general fund expenses of the executive, legislative, and judicial department of the state an amount of more than ninety-nine percent of the estimated continuing general fund receipts in that year. The Legislature shall enact suitable provisions for carrying into effect the provisions of this section.
